review_body: I miss the Solar City App. I can only see daily production and nothing else. I have 3 arrays. I can't tell which produces what or if they are even all working. The ads for the app say you can see production vs use and have all of these breakdowns, but NOPE! For a company that is so technology driven...Full ReviewI miss the Solar City App. I can only see daily production and nothing else. I have 3 arrays. I can't tell which produces what or if they are even all working. The ads for the app say you can see production vs use and have all of these breakdowns, but NOPE! For a company that is so technology driven you would think they would have a much better interface for their solar product....esp after buying a company that did.

All cars should have an accompanying app like this! It's easy to use, convenient, and quite intuitive. However, it still can use a few more capabilities, such as the ability to (1) schedule charging times right from the app, and (2) receive an alert and view a live feed (or at least a snapshot) from...Full ReviewAll cars should have an accompanying app like this! It's easy to use, convenient, and quite intuitive. However, it still can use a few more capabilities, such as the ability to (1) schedule charging times right from the app, and (2) receive an alert and view a live feed (or at least a snapshot) from the cameras as soon as Sentry Mode depicts something. Overall, we love our Model X and this very handy app!

One of the absolute best features of a Tesla. Love everything about it. I have read complaints about some not responding very quickly. I had the same issue with an older phone. With a Pixel 3 it works great. Almost never need to open with the card key. Also love the heating, cooling, sentry mode, ba...Full ReviewOne of the absolute best features of a Tesla. Love everything about it. I have read complaints about some not responding very quickly. I had the same issue with an older phone. With a Pixel 3 it works great. Almost never need to open with the card key. Also love the heating, cooling, sentry mode, battery charging, venting, and every other feature. This is what makes a Tesla different than any other car.

This app worked very well until just after I installed the most recent update. Now I can, maybe once in 24 hours if lucky, see the status of the batteries, power flow, and the percentage of solar/battery/grid usage. Once I could see everything except the battery status. I don't know what happened he...Full ReviewThis app worked very well until just after I installed the most recent update. Now I can, maybe once in 24 hours if lucky, see the status of the batteries, power flow, and the percentage of solar/battery/grid usage. Once I could see everything except the battery status. I don't know what happened here. In talking with Tesla battery support they can see the status of all the equipment on my house.

This app is long over due for an update Please update it. 1) It needs to show % as well distance at the same time, needs to show % and distance as the new/while range is being selected. 2) Needs to show internal and external temperatures. 3) Needs to be able to manipulate scheduled charging from the...Full ReviewThis app is long over due for an update Please update it. 1) It needs to show % as well distance at the same time, needs to show % and distance as the new/while range is being selected. 2) Needs to show internal and external temperatures. 3) Needs to be able to manipulate scheduled charging from the app and charging current. 4) Needs to be able to select a range of temperature while car is parked, climate control schedule. 5) Show current battery capacity in kwh; full capacity and remaining.

The app (which I only use for tracking my solar installation) is very annoying. It keeps logging off every few weeks for no reason (I have browser for that). It keeps logging off every few weeks for no reason (I have browser for that). The CVS export, well hidden BTW, is unusable, given that it would only ever allow me to get like 12 numbers (A day worth of hourly data when looking at day, daily data for week, etc. but no way to e.g. get daily data for a year, not even dreaming about hourly). Charts overinterpolate in day view, towards zero even at noon full production...

Lags getting better. Please add nerd mode option to give 1 decimal point precision in charge rate & range & %battery. Charge complete notification is often late. More API commands please. Please add nerd mode option to give 1 decimal point precision in charge rate & range & %battery. Charge complete notification is often late. More API commands please. Please allow cabin heater to be disabled in software and display cabin temp on car display. Thanks!

It would've great to have a passenger level login. So that the kids can manage the rear heated seats or temperature from their phone without giving them full access to the car. Same goes for third party apps. It would be good to have a token base access that does not allow to open the car or drive i...Full ReviewIt would've great to have a passenger level login. So that the kids can manage the rear heated seats or temperature from their phone without giving them full access to the car. Same goes for third party apps. It would be good to have a token base access that does not allow to open the car or drive it away.

Forced invasion of my phone privacy is NOT needed. Open the access up to desktop!

Tremendous app for Powerwall2. But remember that it gets its data from the cloud and not directly from your Powerwall. So... expect a lag compared to a browser connecting directly to your device over the local LAN. % battery capacity remaining will be 5% lower than the direct browser connection (at ...Full ReviewTremendous app for Powerwall2. But remember that it gets its data from the cloud and not directly from your Powerwall. So... expect a lag compared to a browser connecting directly to your device over the local LAN. % battery capacity remaining will be 5% lower than the direct browser connection (at its lowest point) as it hides the 5% reserve you can otherwise see on the browser. I would like to see more manual controls, e.g. timers, and a "hold" function (neither charge nor discharge).

Works reasonably well with car but missing some key features for example setting departure time to set pre entry climate control. Waking up, waking up, waking up. Have to sign out and back in again to connect. Update: still the same, says waking up and most controls are disabled. However, if I click unlock, it instantly unlocks and the rest of the app then comes to life. Suggesting to me it's the app and not the car.

Been having a hard time using my phone key to wake and unlock the car. Using Note 10+. Tried every single possible combination to get this to work properly. 75% if the time, I have to remove the phone from my bank pocket and use the NFC feature near the side pillar camera to unlock the car. Somethin...Full ReviewBeen having a hard time using my phone key to wake and unlock the car. Using Note 10+. Tried every single possible combination to get this to work properly. 75% if the time, I have to remove the phone from my bank pocket and use the NFC feature near the side pillar camera to unlock the car. Something needs to change. I will be happy to help trouble shoot and send looks if feasible. Thanks.

It would be nice to be able to customize the powerwall settings more. Set storm watch to charge during the battery during certain time. Allow storm watch to allocate up to a certain percent to backup. Example, right now storm watch charges the battery more than 36hrs before the storm is expected, so...Full ReviewIt would be nice to be able to customize the powerwall settings more. Set storm watch to charge during the battery during certain time. Allow storm watch to allocate up to a certain percent to backup. Example, right now storm watch charges the battery more than 36hrs before the storm is expected, so solar is feeding the grid the day prior which is not cost effective.

Love my new model 3. This app is in desperate need of a redesign. You guys are a silicon valley tech company and this app looks like something from the days of the motorola droid. Get some bleeding edge designers and UX people. The design and UX of the car's computer is so well done. I'm surprised t...Full ReviewLove my new model 3. This app is in desperate need of a redesign. The design and UX of the car's computer is so well done. I'm surprised the app doesn't match the design language or quality of that at all.

Buggy. The latest updates have screwed with the ability to stop charging. There is no longer a way to message Tesla through the app. They want us to use self driving and summon but the tire pressure sensors give erroneous readings.

Picked up my new Model 3 Performance a few days ago and so far this app has been flawless. ive had zero issues so far. Car is great and so is the software. (Would like the ability to turn on notifications for Sentry Mode activity.)

The various functions of the app are very convenient. The transitions between functions are very smooth. It's great to be able to use your phone as a key. Being able to turn the phone climate on remotely is a big advantage.
Very helpful, I always wonder when I watched videos why people said that you could like preheat the car from your phone, and this app answered my Qs, and enhances my Model X very much!
Works mostly great. My main annoyance is that the "unlock charge port" button moves when the closest supercharger list loads, making me sometimes hit the wrong button.

Re Powerwall2: Battery % should also be shown at the bottom of the power flow page and it would be good if you could zoom/rescale the energy usage plots. -1* because app wont show battery kwh to powerwall for over anything more than the day (can use to determine efficiency over time)
Very useful features to remotely check, and for some non-driving functions, control your Tesla EV remotely. Good to see ongoing development attention.

I'm not saying it's 100% perfect there's always room for a few additional features to control vehicle functions but it is very good up to now.
Pretty nice app, although I don't like that firing up the app triggers charging to begin. I also wish I could turn on rear defroster to remove ice/snow during pre-heat.

Compared to the old Solar City app, this app is useless. Impossible to navigate and find the simple answers one is looking for. Your online web page is even worse, with zero information available. I would expect more from a leading edge company
4/23/20 Don't know why. But my phone works fine as a key. But can't use Bluetooth in the car for phone calls or to play music. Won't connect.
Does a lot, but the time it takes to connect to the car is annoyingly long. 1% problem, I get it. Hence, 4 stars. Also, the UX is not straight forward.
Love my car. Love the app. I would give it six stars if it would connect slightly faster to the car.
App works great but couldbe more feature rich. I would love to have ability to open Frunk from a function button on my phone or to add shortcuts to lock screen etc.

Slow to connect to the car. Would be good to see some drive statistics and other information too. Don't really like the dark theme. Tesla being a software company this app is not too good. Hope they spend some time to it to develop it more.
Solid app, but I would love for more options in the application for the car. Things like changing between milage and % on the fly, altering charge rate, etc.
Had been working well but since start of April not updating information correctly , battery full 100% then an hour later empty 0% with Little power used and full sunshine
Very well designed app. I love the ability to do a lot of useful things in there car via the app.
Phone key is now reliable. Updates and connects slowly at times. Love the summon as party trick. Await future versions.
Pretty amazing as usual. Works well with the car controls always being there in my notification drawer as well.
the key issue now back. it now DOESN'T recognizes my phone until I wake up my phone. So annoying... why is it so difficult to get this right? Back and forth with every update.
Great, but could be a bit better (especially better and more stable connectivity).

I only have the solar panel. When I tried to log in following the instruction from Tesla, the app says I have no linked product. Very confusing. I will change my rating higher if Tesla can resolve this problem.

This app is awful!!! Gives you zero information cannot find billing account info anything and if your solar is off its absolutely useless. Cannot find out billing on this app or their terrible website.
Thanks for eliminating the guessing game and adding battery percentage number to the charge level visual! If only you can offer an MCU v1 eMMC fix via mobile app.
Worst app on my phone, and unfortunately also one I need to use the most. I call it the "waking up" app since that's all it actually displays. Please fix this Tesla. Shame!

The app now had a lot of features, and most of the functionality could be controlled remotely.
Works very well. No problems at all. Probably the most stable app I've ever used.
For Powerwall operation - app is great would be better with at least two "on-peak" time zones please.
Love my Tesla the app works great. I love that I can use my phone's NFC to unlock my car.

Terrible. I had a solar city plan before they sold out to Tesla. Tesla website and this app is just horribly designed. I can't even pay online its so bad. now I get 503 errors. TESLA makes JUNK
This APP replaced the Solar City APP and I hate it. I only have Tesla Solar and the Solar City APP was superior in every way for that use. This one is a waste of time for me.
Since last update, no issues to report.
Great app, all I need now is to find the money for a Tesla :(
Bug on the powerwall representation of energy consumed from grid.
Very well designed and executed in every way-

It's a pretty solid app, but it could use a little work on some widely reported glitches. For example, it sometimes won't unlock the door unless I hold the phone very close to the car. Also waking up for status info can get stuck and take a very long time to timeout and retry. For example, it sometimes won't unlock the door unless I hold the phone very close to the car. Also waking up for status info can get stuck and take a very long time to timeout and retry. The features are really cool, although it would benefit from enhancements there as well. For example, more charging options and info on the percent charge selected.

I understand that this app is not entirely for solar, but I dislike that we were forced to go to this app from the Solar City app. The Solar City app had so much more functionality. I could see the individual production from both of my solar systems. If we are going to be forced to use a product at least make it comparable to what is being replaced.

This app went from being extremely fast and responsive to being sluggish, unresponsive, and a little frustrating to use. There are also some weird issues around car functions and user accounts. Keeps shuting down. It's telling me now that I don't have products attached to this app.

All I'm getting is production. Nothing from two Powerwall. No powerflow. Nothing.

Good app generally but needs a widget for home screen. it would also be good if it allowed you to see more historical data, but that would just be a perk. Update - Tesla now lets you view your historical data so that is no longer an issue. Now just need that widget...

Great App, however car sometimes will not wake up from time to time. A feedback to give is to have the owner's manual available via the app just to make it easier to find it instead of looking for the book or via the car's touchscreen.

I love the idea of the app, and when it's working, I really love it, but there have been key moments when I needed it and it's stuck on "Waking Up". This isn't just lag. It is waking up for hours sometimes. Please fix the lag and the complete freeze of the app. It's an important feature of the car a...Full ReviewI love the idea of the app, and when it's working, I really love it, but there have been key moments when I needed it and it's stuck on "Waking Up". Lots of great ideas and hard work went into these vehicles. Fix the app out of respect.

Often times does not open Tesla car door. I have to take my phone out and launch the app first, which I shouldn't have to. Also, the app often times does not connect to the car. It just keeps spinning and let's me know when it was last update. Very frustrating!
Excellent, feature rich app for an ex excellent car

Using it for solar panels, does not work. When looking at the inverter, it says that power is produced. When looking at the app connected to the gateway, it says that there is no solar offset (ever). Please fix it.

At times quite slow to start and connect to the car. Additionally the restrictions applied to the use of the summon function by the EU has made the function a whole lot less convenient.

Update: The problem is fixed by a setting on the phone. I am not going to change the rating however, because I think Tesla should have a checklist to follow when the phone key doesn't work. I would guess that they have seen my problem many times before and could easily suggest checking the settings ...Full ReviewUpdate: The problem is fixed by a setting on the phone. I am not going to change the rating however, because I think Tesla should have a checklist to follow when the phone key doesn't work. I would guess that they have seen my problem many times before and could easily suggest checking the settings as follows: On the S8 Settings/Device Care/Battery/Tesla make sure that Put App to Sleep is OFF. I think that a Tmobile update a few months ago must have changed the default of Put App to Sleep to ON. Before a few months ago (for nearly a year) the phone key had no problem. On an S8, phone key fails more often than it works. Intermittant, frequently stays nonworking and I must go through the key setup to get it to work. Tesla: Forget the games and get the phone key to work. I am going to have to buy a fob.

Would be good to have an open front trunk and charge controls from seperate apps so I don't have to open the full app everytime. More battery and charge stats too.

For the car - Can you please add the ability define charging time periods in terms or start time and stop when either a percentage or time is reached. A widget like you offer to iPhone users would be nice too.

I like the new UI and the updated app works as well as the old one. However, it really is a missed opportunity to provide much needed functionality. For example, the ability to switch on the rear screen / mirror defrost, control fan speed or reset the climate control to full auto, and switch on the ...Full ReviewI like the new UI and the updated app works as well as the old one. However, it really is a missed opportunity to provide much needed functionality. For example, the ability to switch on the rear screen / mirror defrost, control fan speed or reset the climate control to full auto, and switch on the seat heaters. Less critical but nice would be the ability to send a route to the sat nav. I look forward to the next update. Update: Everything I suggested has since been added, and it works.

Update: since the 1 Dec 2018 update installed this morning my powerwall is apparently unavailable and no data available. App has become useless. Used with a powerwall 2. Would be a nice feature to have a 'time to full charge' shown at the current rate of charging. It's a slick app, which looks great...Full ReviewUpdate: since the 1 Dec 2018 update installed this morning my powerwall is apparently unavailable and no data available. App has become useless. Used with a powerwall 2. Would be a nice feature to have a 'time to full charge' shown at the current rate of charging. It's a slick app, which looks great. But limited historic data, compare with the solaredge app where you can see day by day not just aggregated data. Most annoying thing is how it logs you out so you need to keep a note of your password handy. If you can't enter it, the app threatens to delete all your data and settings.
Still missing an option to finally add intermediate stops to a route. But it's starting to get there.
Our cars get better with age, and this app helps make that happen. My only wish is to be able to set the charge time via the app.

Uninstalling/reinstalling does not help. It also regularly has problems establishing a connection to the car and while attempting to esta...Full ReviewThe notifications for Supercharging never work. The app is supposed to give a notification when charging is "almost" complete, and then again when it is complete. Uninstalling/reinstalling does not help. It also regularly has problems establishing a connection to the car and while attempting to establish a connection it will show the last data from when I last viewed the app. It should ideally have data from when it last communicated with the car. Needs more charging reminder options. Please open up the API to let 3rd party developers create a better app, or poach a best in class "Android" dev team. On that note, PLEASE allow Android Auto and CarPlay on the vehicle. You'll never get close to them, so just support them. It would be great to get notification if a scheduled charge is not going to take place due to a wall connector issue, or if low on battery. It would save someone from waking up to a dead Tesla. It would also be good to initiate software updates to the car through the app (from push notifications indicating an update is ready).  It's disconcerting that a company that will soon be implementing autonomous driving is not [even close to] a leader in software development.

This didn't begin happening with my headphones or my Gear S3 watch until we installed the Tesla app 2 weeks ago when we took delivery of model 3. Overall we are stoked with all things Tesla!

The new Tesla app is beautifully designed and effectively leverages the "connected" nature of today's cars. This app is a fantastic way to communicate with your car from anywhere, as long as you and your car are connected to the network. The newest version has finally added the much requested featur...Full ReviewThe new Tesla app is beautifully designed and effectively leverages the "connected" nature of today's cars. This app is a fantastic way to communicate with your car from anywhere, as long as you and your car are connected to the network. The newest version has finally added the much requested features to allow preconditioning the seats and defrost the windows/windshield upon turning on climate controls. This is absolutely incredible for places like Canada where we face winters with lots of freezing rain and snow. I am excited to see this app evolve and I am waiting to see more additional controls that further enhances the capabilities of the Tesla fleet. The future is bright for Tesla. Looking forward to more innovations.

Does awesome things, but three stars doesn't come close to showing how far it is from meeting its potential. This app could tell you if your tire pressure got too low so that you don't ever find your car with a flat, and it won't. It could let you plan a trip including Supercharger times, from your ...Full ReviewDoes awesome things, but three stars doesn't come close to showing how far it is from meeting its potential. This app could tell you if your tire pressure got too low so that you don't ever find your car with a flat, and it won't. It could let you plan a trip including Supercharger times, from your current location *or elsewhere*, and it won't. It could probably let you view the vehicle's cameras to check on your car, and it won't. It could tell you if it starts to rain using the rain sensor, and it won't. It could let you roll your windows up if you left them down, and it won't. It could alert you if the interior temperature changed too much, and it won't. It could probably let you open and close the trunk for someone while keeping the other doors locked, and it won't. It could let you raise or lower the suspension which could be useful, but probably would be just for fun, and it won't.

Read if App is Crashing for you Update - app is now working fine with Dashlane on my Nexus 5 and LastPass on my Sony Xperia 3.  Tesla Owners:  If you have downloaded this app and it is crashing on you, the problem most likely is a password manager or custom keyboard application that you have installed.  For example, DashLane and L...Full ReviewUpdate - app is now working fine with Dashlane on my Nexus 5 and LastPass on my Sony Xperia 3.  Tesla Owners:  If you have downloaded this app and it is crashing on you, the problem most likely is a password manager or custom keyboard application that you have installed.  For example, DashLane and Lastpass will cause this app to crash.  You will need to uninstall the password management app from your device until Tesla dev team can look at how to address this use case scenario.

Additional features I'd really like to see in descending order of importance:  1) Ability to select driver profiles before getting into vehicle (...Full ReviewHard to believe this is a "beta" app. Works very well on my older Evo 4G, w/ the exception of the location map UI bug that many others have commented on.  Additional features I'd really like to see in descending order of importance:  1) Ability to select driver profiles before getting into vehicle (I'm a foot taller than my wife, so having the seat ready for me would be huge) 2) Open/close windows 3) Security PIN option for app in case your phone is lost/stolen 4) Immediately notify app owner if the alarm goes off 5) Shortcut for contacting Tesla Roadside Assistance 6) Set/change a charging schedule 7) Schedule climate control changes 8) Open/close power rear hatch (when equipped) 9) Send a destination from your phone to the vehicle via the app   For other users, if you encounter a long delay while trying to connect, try pressing the home button and "relaunching" the Tesla app. That seems to always result in an immediate connection. Also, for those that encounter continued battery drain after viewing the vehicle on your phone, try "backing out" of the app w/ the back button rather than just powering off w/ the app still active (always works for me).

Fully Functional So far, everything seems to be fully functional. No glitches that I could see. It's a nice touch that the image of the car is color-coded to match your actual car color. It has a good 1-3s response time. I guess that's to be expected though. It's not like a TV remote. Even if you're standing right n...Full ReviewSo far, everything seems to be fully functional. No glitches that I could see. It's a nice touch that the image of the car is color-coded to match your actual car color. It has a good 1-3s response time. I guess that's to be expected though. It's not like a TV remote. Even if you're standing right next to the car, the signal is traveling for miles and miles, through several exchanges and protocols before it ever hits the car.
